收件者： ccu@rthk.hk、kwleung@rthk.hk
副本：ccibenq@cedb.gov.hk
主旨：Appreciation for 28/3/2020 episode of The Pulse

Dear Sir,

I am writing to express my heartfelt appreciation for the latest episode of The Pulse, aired 28 March 2020, and to laud the effort The Pulse's production tram in extensively covering and truthfully presenting to the Hong Kong audience the global pandemic of the coronavirus.

The Pulse's reporters travelled to Lombardy of Italy, New York City and London, three of the world's worst-hit regions in the coronavirus pandemic, and investigated how governments and people are struggling to cope with the continuous spread of the virus and the ensuing crisis. Despite the stringent resources, the episode well reflects its capability to offer quality coverage of local and global news.

I am particularly impressed by the professionalism demonstrated by Yvonne Tong in her interview with Bruce Aylward, assistant director-general of World Health Organisation. Taiwan has been one of the most succession place where the virus's spread is largely contained and under control, despite being excluded from the WHO. In this context, Ms. Tong was straight and insistent in discussing Taiwan's situation with Mr. Aylward. Such frankness and directness is rarely seen in both local and international media in investigating and reporting WHO's role in the ongoing pandemic.

Please extend my sincere gratitude to The Pulse's production team in offering such an excellent coverage. While anticipating more high-quality reporting from The Pulse and other RTHK programmes, I urge the government's Commerce and Economic Development Bureau to allocate more resources to RTHK, in order for our public broadcaster to keep up with its good works.

Yours faithfully,

港台節目顧問團吹雞
